title: Apsara 2014 Las Madres Vineyard Whole Cluster Syrah (Carneros)
description: With a touch of reduction, this is a rustic, complex and light-bodied wine. It's soft on the palate, layered with gunpowder, meat and lavender notes. Used French oak plays a supportive and unobtrusive role.

title: Badia di Morrona 2013 Taneto Red (Toscana)
description: Made of 70% Syrah, 15% Sangiovese and 15% Merlot, this opens with ripe black plum and tilled earth scents. The dense palate doles out prune, clove and game flavors, pulled taut by assertive tannins. Drink through 2018.

title: Bernardus 2014 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Faint cranberry and incense aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers more flavors, including coffee, black tar, pomegranate and peppercorns.

title: Viña Bujanda 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Slightly herbal aromas veer off in the direction of grassy and rooty. This feels jagged and a bit choppy, with gritty roasted berry flavors. On the finish, that same gritty character persists and is joined by a tarry note.

title: Canneto 2012 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Ripe, dark-skinned berry, blue flower and Mediterranean herb aromas emerge on the nose. The palate offers toast, roasted coffee and star anise flavors, with bracing, grainy tannins that leave a tongue-drying finish.

title: Château Braude Fellonneau 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: Owned by the Margaux estate of Château Mongravey, this small property is located in Macau in the southern Médoc. The wine is soft and generous with ripe berry fruits and light tannins. It does have an edge of tannins that are there to give the wine its shape. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Chantemerle 2014  Médoc
description: The Cruchon family has produced a ripe structured wine with a high proportion (60%) of Cabernet Sauvignon. It has black fruits and acidity along with firm tannins and a juicy future. Drink from 2019.

title: Bogati 2015 Malbec (Virginia)
description: Rich kirsch, red cherry and lavender aromas are intense on the nose. The palate offers similar notes, with a juicy cranberry flavor that brightens up the astringent tannins. The finish is alive in lingering berry flavors.

title: Boscarelli 2015 Prugnolo  (Rosso di Montepulciano)
description: Rose, violet, sour berry and tilled earth aromas take center stage in this young red. The easygoing palate offers rounded tannins and wild cherry, black raspberry and clove flavors. A mineral note signals the finish.

title: Château Patache d'Aux 2016 Barrel Sample  (Médoc)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. This wine has a strong, minty character. Allied to the wood and black currant fruit, the mint adds freshness to the wine's already crisp texture. It will be ready by 2027.

title: Château Pierre de Montignac 2014  Médoc
description: Ripe Merlot and layers of toasty wood flavors are the initial tastes of this young wine. It does have weight and plenty of blackberry fruit. The aftertaste is crisp and fruity with a dry edge from the young tannins. Drink from 2020.

title: Col d'Orcia 2014 Banditella  (Rosso di Montalcino)
description: Made from organically grown Sangiovese grapes, this opens with red berry, cooking spice and espresso aromas. The medium-bodied palate doles out wild cherry, vanilla and toast flavors, framed by fine-grained tannins and bright acidity.

title: Coldisole 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Vanilla, spiced plum, leather and toast scents come together in the glass. The palate offers black-skinned fruit, tobacco and star anise flavors, with a backbone of assertive tannins lending grip.

title: Cowhorn 2015 Marsanne-Roussanne (Applegate Valley)
description: This 50-50 blend remains hard edged and wound up tight at this point in time. Sharp citrus flavors dominate the crisp green apple. Aged just four months in 20% new oak, there is little or no evidence of any impact. Give this at least another year of bottle age, maybe two, before drinking.

title: David Bruce 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: This is tart, tannic and still somewhat youthfully unresolved, showing a touch of reduction. It otherwise traffics in crowd-pleasing raspberry and cherry pie flavors.

title: Decoy 2014 Red (Sonoma County)
description: An approachable blend of more than half Merlot with smaller additions of Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, this wine offers a touch of smoke on the nose and firm structure, wrapped around straightforward cassis flavors.

title: Caccia al Piano 1868 2013 Ruit Hora  (Bolgheri)
description: Made of 65% Merlot, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Syrah and 5% Petit Verdot, this has delicate black plum and baking spice aromas. The straightforward palate offers cassis, cocoa and a hint of vanilla, framed by firm, fine-grained tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Traslascuestas 2011 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Saucy herbal lightly grassy aromas surround an interior scent of black cherry. This feels thick and raisiny, and on the ripe side. Flavors of raisin, prune, brandied cherry and spice finish peppery. Drink now.

title: Trerose 2015 Salterio  (Rosso di Montepulciano)
description: Purple flower, dark-skinned berry and brown spice aromas lead the nose of this young wine. The straightforward palate shows dried black cherry, powdered sage and a hint of espresso with lithe tannins. Drink soon.

title: Uccelliera 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Earthy truffle, porcini mushroom, herb and game scents fill the glass. The palate is robust with rustic appeal, offering dried cherry, cured meat, sage and a salty finish. Grainy tannins provide support, while alcohol leaves a warmth on the finish. Drink after 2020.

title: Viña Somoza 2015 Sobre Lias Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Slightly briny and pickled on the nose, this Godello could benefit from being more fruity up front. Lemony acidity and a stony sensation define the mouthfeel, while this tastes lemony, briny and a touch bready from lees stirring.

title: Von Strasser 2013 Post Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: A firm, integrated wine from a mountain appellation, this vineyard designate contains a hearty 16% Malbec and 4% Merlot. Cinnamon, cedar and dried herb notes enwrap its subtle black cherry and cassis fruit.

title: Tenuta Forconi 2015  Chianti
description: Made of 80% Sangiovese, 10% Colorino and 10% Canaiolo, this opens with violet and redcurrant aromas. The straightforward palate delivers ripe black cherry and underbrush notes with a fine layer of smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Sokol Blosser 2014 Evolution Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This vintage-dated Pinot Noir is the newest addition to the Evolution lineup. Tart and tangy, its light and lively pomegranate and raspberry flavors come from grapes principally fermented in stainless steel. In your wine-drinking pantheon, it might find a comfortable place alongside a cru Beaujolais.

title: Soléna 2015 Domaine Danielle Laurent Chardonnay (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Production volume is up, but the concentration does not match the excellent 2014 edition of this reserve-level wine. There are modestly ripe melon and green apple flavors, along with a touch of buttered toast.

title: Soléna 2015 Domaine Danielle Laurent Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: A common thread among the 2015 Soléna Pinots is a stiff herbal beet flavor rather than fully ripe berry fruit. This tilts into cranberry and very tart raspberry, but finishes astringent and hard. Give it plenty of decanting (two or three hours) to help it open up.

title: Spann Vineyards 2014 Yin-Yang Chardonnay-Viognier (Sonoma County)
description: This blend of 60% Chardonnay with 40% Viognier opens with buttery popcorn aromas that lead into lithe, silky apple and apricot flavors. Restrained in its oak use, just hinting at vanilla, it has a tangy finish.

title: Château Jacques Noir 2014  Saint-Émilion
description: Produced at one of the group of chateaus owned by the Ducourt family, this wine is bright, fruity and with a light tannic touch. It has a fine balance between its black fruits and its structure which will let it age well. Drink from 2022.

title: Château La Serre 2016 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. This wine is juicy, packed with attractive berry fruits. It has a layer of solid tannins, but the main asset of the wine is its fruitiness.

title: Villa S. Anna 2013  Rosso di Montepulciano
description: Oak, vanilla, underbrush and spiced plum scents float out of the glass. The palate is lean and linear, offering sour cherry and star anise flavors, pulled taut by firm acidity and refined tannins.
